comment: This was by far the easiest class I have ever taken. And I learned so much. She makes every class very interesting. You have many different reflections, a presentation, and like two very simple and opinionated papers. I can't stress enough how easy this class is.

Professor McClatchey  is the sweetest little old Swedish lady and she runs her own grief camp for children. She knows a LOT about the process of dying and grief and i respect her very much (she has a sense of humor too!). No tests AT ALL: just discussions, reflection papers, and a final paper. I have a 100. If you are human you can get an A.

Nothing like what I expected from a death and dying class. Actually one of the best classes I have taken at KSU. Took her maymester. Do the work and you will pass. Take this class if you can! Gave me a new perspective on dying. Passed this class without the book, had to be resourceful ;)
She is such a nice lady. She is a great teacher & I learned so much. It is an interesting class.
Very easy class. As long as you do the work, you will make an A

Professor McClatchey is a nice professor. As long as you do your work, you will pass the course with an A or B. There are NO TEST, only reflection papers on videos and guess speakers, and a small presentation about a movie, and two small essays. NOTE: DO NOT BUY THE TEXT.

I really enjoyed Dr McClatchey's Death, Dying And Bereavement class this semester. She is extremely helpful and accommodating. Emotionally this class is hard, but everyone cries in it at some point, and I cried almost every single day so you won't be alone. It is so worth it though! A very cleansing class!

Ms McClatchey is a very sweet professor. There is a midterm, a final, attendance, and 20 hours of volunteer work that you have to do. She gives study guides. She posts her powerpoints online. I was a little shocked by how many bigots were in a human services class, so don't expect everyone to be tolerant in this field like I did.

A great professor! She is helpful and explains things. She is a fair teacher with a good attitude. If you are trying to get into grant writing go to class and attend when she has guest speakers I found all of the info extremely relevant.
Prof McClatchey is a great professor. She?s really knowledgeable about what she does. She?s also helpful, nice and funny. Do your work and go to class. You?ll learn a lot from her.

Excellent class! I learned so much about the grief process and about death rituals in different cultures. Dr. McClatchey is an incredible teacher- the work load is extremely light- no tests at all. Only reaction papers and other fun assignments. Very enjoyable class and excellent teacher. Highly recommend this class and prof!
